options.content:
Accounts & Smart Contracts

Active accounts and smart contracts over the last 90 days

panels.description: See explainer below.
panels.title: Active Accounts

panels.description: The most recent 7 day period compared to the previous 7 day period.
panels.title: Change (7 Days)

panels.description: The most recent 30 day period compared to the previous 30 day period.
panels.title: Change (30 Days)

panels.description: The most recent 90 day period compared to the previous 90 day period.
panels.title: Change (90 Days)

options.content: An active account is any account that originates at least one transaction during a given timeframe. Unlike accounts that only receive value or tokens, active accounts must initiate an operation—such as sending a payment or interacting with a service—thus demonstrating direct network engagement. This includes smart contracts. View methodology & documentation →

panels.description: See explainer below.
panels.title: Developer Accounts

panels.description: The most recent 7 day period compared to the previous 7 day period.
panels.title: Change (7 Days)

panels.description: The most recent 30 day period compared to the previous 30 day period.
panels.title: Change (30 Days)

panels.description: The most recent 90 day period compared to the previous 90 day period.
panels.title: Change (90 Days)

options.content: A developer account is any account that performs at least one “creative” or infrastructure-oriented action over a specified period. Examples include deploying or updating smart contracts, creating or minting tokens, or setting up and modifying consensus topics. These accounts represent users who are actively building or expanding the network’s capabilities rather than simply consuming existing services. View methodology & documentation →

panels.description: See explainer below.
panels.title: Retail Accounts

panels.description: The most recent 7 day period compared to the previous 7 day period.
panels.title: Change (7 Days)

panels.description: The most recent 30 day period compared to the previous 30 day period.
panels.title: Change (30 Days)

panels.description: The most recent 90 day period compared to the previous 90 day period.
panels.title: Change (90 Days)

options.content: A "retail account" is essentially an active account that is neither a developer account nor a smart contract account. This category is determined after identifying active and developer accounts, as well as distinguishing active smart contracts. View methodology & documentation →

panels.description: See explainer below.
panels.title: Active Smart Contracts

panels.description: The most recent 7 day period compared to the previous 7 day period.
panels.title: Change (7 Days)

panels.description: The most recent 30 day period compared to the previous 30 day period.
panels.title: Change (30 Days)

panels.description: The most recent 90 day period compared to the previous 90 day period.
panels.title: Change (90 Days)

options.content: The number of unique smart contracts that have been invoked through at least one state-changing (gas-consuming) transaction within a specified time window. This statistic highlights how many contracts are actively in use, rather than just deployed and idle, providing a snapshot of real engagement and activity in the ecosystem. View methodology & documentation →

TVL & Stablecoin Market Cap

Current day totals for value locked and stablecoin market cap (including recent change).

panels.description: See explainer below.

targets.rawSql: select total from ecosystem.metric where name = 'network_tvl' and period = 'day' order by timestamp_range desc limit 1;

panels.title: Total Value Locked (TVL)

panels.description: The most recent 7 day period compared to the previous 7 day period.

targets.rawSql:
WITH previous AS (
    SELECT total 
    FROM ecosystem.metric 
    WHERE name = 'network_tvl'
    AND period = 'day'
    ORDER BY timestamp_range DESC 
    OFFSET 7 LIMIT 1
), 
current AS (
    SELECT total 
    FROM ecosystem.metric 
    WHERE name = 'network_tvl'
    AND period = 'day'
    ORDER BY timestamp_range DESC 
    LIMIT 1
)
SELECT 
    (current.total::decimal / previous.total - 1) * 100 AS change
FROM current, previous;

panels.title: Change (7 Days)

panels.description: The most recent 30 day period compared to the previous 30 day period.

targets.rawSql:
WITH previous AS (
    SELECT total 
    FROM ecosystem.metric 
    WHERE name = 'network_tvl'
    AND period = 'day'
    ORDER BY timestamp_range DESC 
    OFFSET 30 LIMIT 1
), 
current AS (
    SELECT total 
    FROM ecosystem.metric 
    WHERE name = 'network_tvl'
    AND period = 'day'
    ORDER BY timestamp_range DESC 
    LIMIT 1
)
SELECT 
    (current.total::decimal / previous.total - 1) * 100 AS change
FROM current, previous;

targets.rawSql:
WITH previous AS (

    FROM ecosystem.metric

    ORDER BY timestamp_range DESC 
    OFFSET 90 LIMIT 1

current AS (

    LIMIT 1
)
SELECT 
    (current.total::decimal / previous.total - 1) * 100 AS change
FROM current, previous;

panels.title: Change (90 Days)

options.content: Total Value Locked (TVL) represents the total amount of assets locked within decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols on the Hedera network. This metric provides insights into liquidity, ecosystem adoption, and capital efficiency within Hedera’s DeFi landscape. This leverages data from 3rd party data sources like DeFi Llama. View methodology & documentation →

panels.description: See explainer below.

targets.rawSql: select total from ecosystem.metric where name = 'stablecoin_marketcap' and period = 'day' order by timestamp_range desc limit 1;

panels.title: Stablecoin Market Cap

panels.description: The most recent 7 day period compared to the previous 7 day period.

targets.rawSql:
WITH previous AS (
    SELECT total 
    FROM ecosystem.metric 
    WHERE name = 'stablecoin_marketcap'
    AND period = 'day'
    ORDER BY timestamp_range DESC 
    OFFSET 7 LIMIT 1
), 
current AS (
    SELECT total 
    FROM ecosystem.metric 
    WHERE name = 'stablecoin_marketcap'
    AND period = 'day'
    ORDER BY timestamp_range DESC 
    LIMIT 1
)
SELECT 
    (current.total::decimal / previous.total - 1) * 100 AS change
FROM current, previous;

panels.title: Change (7 Days)

SELECT

options.content: The Stablecoin Market Cap statistic tracks the total market capitalization of stablecoins circulating on the Hedera network. This statistic provides insight into the adoption and liquidity of stablecoins within the ecosystem. View methodology & documentation →

Revenue

Total transaction fees collected in the last 90 days.

panels.description: See explainer below.
panels.title: Revenue

panels.description: The most recent 7 day period compared to the previous 7 day period.
panels.title: Change (7 days)

panels.description: The most recent 30 day period compared to the previous 30 day period.
panels.title: Change (30 Days)

panels.description: The most recent 30 day period compared to the previous 30 day period.
panels.title: Change (90 Days)

options.content: Hedera’s revenue is the sum of all transaction fees across the mainnet. Each transaction pays fees to the consensus nodes, the staking account, the node rewards account, and the Hedera treasury. By examining each transaction and tracking these fee allocations, Hedera calculates its total network revenue and breaks it down by service type (HTS, HSCS, HCS, and Other). View methodology & documentation →
